Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Price/Quality in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RFBM
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with the family for 2 nights in March 2012. The hotel was a good choice. Main Aspects: 1) Very Clean; 2) Large space (for 2 adults and 2 children) 3) Very well situated (near the train station on Grand Canal) 4) Great breakfast; 5) Friendly Staff; 6) Free Internet Connection I would go back again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Very Venetian”
Reviews.Author: GideonJerubbaal
Reviews.Content: Venice is very unusual town for an outsider. There is no cars. The night lights are dim and mystical. When you arrive at the Santa Lucia train station at night see you find yourself on an ordinary European train station. You go out and your heart jumps a few beats. The ethereal city is hung in the air across the Grand Canale. This is Santa Croce borough (siestere) over there and the Capri hotel is there too, very Venetianly hiding itself in a maze of narrow alleys but only a few dozen meters from the waterfront. The hotel is very very close to the Piazzale Roma bus station (take the bus to the Marco Polo airport from there) and to the Santa Lucia train station (for Verona or Padova or Milano or other places in nearby Europe). Remember ther is no cars? Waterbus won't help you to get there from the train station, so it's very good that the walk with the luggage is short. Perfect. Closer to the train or bus station it would be too many people around. Carlton Capri is isolated but very near to a main footway across the islands to the major tourist borough, San Marco. It is a good walk though, so if you don't feel like walking you have to cross the bridge to the train satation (ferrovia) and take a vaporetto. Bloody expensive, those things are. I'd prefer walk anytime of day: you see so much around and it's impossible to loose your bearings because there a post showing you directions just everywhere. That the location. The hotel itself is great. The breakfast is great. Cofffe absolutely the best I tasted at any hotel anywhere.The stuff friendly. Rooms are high ceilinged. The bathroom is fairly big by European standards, room sized more or less regularly. Would be just perfect but the heating/airconditiong ducts were giving me some low volume but constant noise (this is just me being very light sleeper, I gather most of the people won't even notice this noise). Wi-Fi was free but the signal was very weak on the 1st floor, usable in the lobby. Also I would say this hotel is rather overpriced but for Venice normal values could not be applied, so ther it may be even considered budget. I was there in February, it was chilly outside but always warm inside. Can't say what happens in summer when Venice air becomes unbearable. Highly recommended. Very convenient for getting to/from the airport. Nice area.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location, family friendly, good value for money"”
Reviews.Author: tsaranastasia
Reviews.Content: Capri Carlton is a 5-minute walk from St. Lucia Station (and Grand Canal and vaporettos), central, but quiet. The location is really great! Nice rooms,modern bathrooms, very clean, good breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. (We arrived very early in the morning, and were able to check-in sooner as pointed out in the hotel conditions, which was helpful, as we came with a child). Very family friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Nolam_bcn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place, the staff was nice, breakfast was very good with lot of choice. It was very clean, and the bedroom was cleaned everyday. We slept well. We had a nice balcony and a beautiful view on the roofs of Venice. One thing is that we were on the 4th floor but the lift stops at the 3rd floor. However, it did not matter at all, because our luggage was not heavy. Moreover everything else was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: nerak1234
Reviews.Content: Travelled with parents 80 and 78. The location is very convenient and clean. Across from the Train stn. Along, but behind the Grand Canal. Piazale Roma is so close, it's where you can catch the bus to the airport ; only 5 Euros/person! A good 30 minute walk to San Marco and Rialto Bridge. Vaporetti is very expensive 6E each way. Day pass is good 13E /p that way you can hop on and off . Note: if you plan on staying longer than a week or you are doing a lot of vaporetting, then go to the bus stn -piazale Roma and fill out some form and that will allow you to pay 1.25 E for each way. I wondered how the locals paid 6E each way each time. Btw, on the day pass you can go to Lido and take a local bus from there- all on the pass .That way you can rest your feet and let the bus take you around; because in Venice you will be climbing a lot of bridges and your legs will beg for rest. Hotel: Staff were helpful...Stefano and Ricardo were helpful. Our room was not producing cool AC, we had to request for a fan..which was finally given to us. Our sleep was being affected drastically. Room: Clean, Comfortable for 3 of us...albeit a bit small. Toilette was immaculate as well with toilettries and bidet. Breakfast : Room was a bit too cosy for liking. Food items plenty, ample and fulfilling. Heathy choices, eggs, bacon, ham, cheese, etc. Coffee pot was placed at your table. Cappucino was provided cheerfully on request -no extra charge. Breakfast staff were courteous,gracious and obliging. Avoid Venice, Florence and Rome in August if you can. It is truly very, very, very unbearably hot!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel carlton capri, venice, italy”
Reviews.Author: mth5
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Italy with a group of 5 girls, ages 16-20. We had 2 rooms, 3 in each room. The rooms were small for 3 but clean with a modern bathroom and quiet. We were able to check in early and head off to sightseeing. The staff was polite and helpful. The breakfast was good. They recommended 2 good restaurants for us. It was well located for us as we took the bus from the airport to the hotel. It was only a 5 minute walk from the bus plaza, across the canal and down an alley to the hotel. It was across the canal from the train termini. Would not hesitate to stay here for this location, good price and clean, quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, nice breakfast near to main train station”
Reviews.Author: raj_arian52
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay..nice breakfast. This hotel is very close to the main train station, veporetto stop, bus stop Piazzale Roma but this is very far from St. Marks square and Rialto bridge although you can reach there by walking in 30-45 mins. The room quality is good and room service is as it should be. The staffs are very nice and helpful. We Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume L
Reviews.Content: Overall very satisfied with my stay. I loved the location since it was very close to the train station and I also in a quiet and nice area. Very helpfull staff and great price! The room was nice and cozy with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TTgas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Carlton Capri for three nights, The Staff were helpful and polite especially Stefano at the reception area, who seemed to be there 24/7. The breakfast was very good with hot scrambled egg & bacon as well as cold meats, cheese, jams, yoghurt, fruit etc. The room that we had was clean and a reasonable size but showed signs of wear and tear. There is plenty to do in this area, and the Bus and Railway stations are very nearby. Finding the Hotel is easy if you stand in front of The Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal then go through the metal gate (locked after 9pm in November) to the right and turn right at the end of the buildings you will find the Carlton Capri. We would use this hotel again, as we see it as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne L
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel : the staff is helpful, the room and bathroom are clean, no street noise, WI FI in the room. Close to bus, train and vaporetto stations. To improve : the quality of bread and pastries for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Another_TravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice and clean, all the staff were very friendly, helpful, spoke and understood English very well. It is extremely close to the Train Station and all the Water Bus stops, which is no more than a three minute walk. We had no issues finding the hotel, I will admit before we left for Italy I used Google Maps to get a better view of the Hotel and mapped out our route from the airport which worked out great for us and we got there in no time at all. The map the Hotel email's to you will also do just as good. Upon arriving at the Hotel we had a very friendly greeting and the Concierge gave us a City Map, although I still stuck with the Street Wise map that we picked up at a local Barnes and Noble. The Concierge was very helpful and gave us great information and recommendations from their personal take on places to eat according to our price range, they also gave us the best place to catch a Gondola ride, and even looked up the train schedule for us. The hotel does offer free Wi-Fi in their lobby in case you have a Wi-Fi enabled device. The room we had was a good size although when I saw another room it did appear smaller than ours, they come equipped with the basic Fridge, Safe, Hair Dryer, Hot Rack for Towels, and Satellite TV â€œin Italianâ€�. There is not an Iron in the rooms since it poses a Fire Hazard to have them in the rooms but they do offer a service for cloths if you would like that done. Things that are just around the bend from the Hotel is a Laundry Mat, Internet CafÃ©, Tabacchi shop â€œwhich is like your local convenience storeâ€�, ATM and a playground for the kids. At a further walk â€œabout 5minsâ€� by the Car parking lot you can find a Post Office and a small little Grocery store. We were really happy with the location of this Hotel it is off the Grand Canal which was great since it got us away from all the tourist traffic and the noise from all the boats which make noise and honk like a busy highway, it was tucked away in a very nice and peaceful spot. Their continental breakfast was very nice with a wide variety of foods to choose from and well worth to catch each day. While speaking of food there are plenty of places to dine just a short walk from the hotel for both Lunch and Dinner. Also if you get the late night munchies or just want a quick bite to eat there are places near the Train station that are open late. We arrived on the 19th of October and checked out on the 26th when we arrived the A/C was turned off and the Heat was on, there is a thermostat in the room to control the heat or you can turn it off and open up the window. The beds were very comfortable we had a Queen size bed that was made up of two twins locked together, you couldnâ€™t even tell that they were twins it felt the same through the whole bed and the seam connecting the two in the middle seemed like it wasn't even there that it was just one big bed. In all we were extremely pleased with our stay and service, it was way more than we expected from a three star hotel, we will defiantly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volgar
Reviews.Content: The Carlton Capri is a good hotel in a good place: 3 minutes from Piazzala Roma and Central Railway station. And 10...15 minutes to San Marko. The staff are friendly. The rooms were small but very nice and enough for some days. The bathroom was big and clear. Wi-Fi works but only on ground floor - you need to walk with notebook to reception. Only problem - to find hotel location first time especially midnight :) Don't use map from hotel website - use Google map.

Reviews.Title: “Sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cotecicotela
Reviews.Content: Nice surprise. Located in Ã  quiet campo, no noise, tourists. Great location to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: petlol
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient for train and airport bus arrival or departure. As mentioned by earlier reviewers, the hotel is not easy to find if you do not have detailed directions. Our room was a good size but the bathroom was small. It is a very clean and well-managed hotel. Matteo at reception gave us outstanding service and phoned Rome to book a time at Borghese Gallery. The breakfast is good with very good service by the friendly waitresses. The hotel is expensive but no more so than the other hotels in this expensive city. We would have no hesitation in staying here again if we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: daisydoo907
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel lovely and friendly staff and good breakfast. However our room was so small one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in the decor is very old fashioned but clean. Location is good but I would have an issue in recommending this hotel to anyone all just due to its bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: trchaseKY
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest room of the three hotels we stayed in Italy. The room was pretty basic but it did have a balcony which was very nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I rated it lower than others because of the room size relative to the price. It was a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “not the one on the canal”
Reviews.Author: beth r
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the hotel. It was not the one positioned right on the canal. The AC blew cold and the staff was very nice. They actually liked us Americano!!!! It was at a good location and very quick walk to the Grand Canal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean, comfortable and well located to the bus and train station. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast excellent. Near lots of good restaurants. We would recommend this and use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, but a bit disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: kamonkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for just one night due to a fairly hectic schedule, and were really looking forward to the experience. We arrived by train, and luckily The Carlton Capri was very close to the St Lucia train station - over the bridge and a short walk, so that was very convenient. On check in, the reception staff seemed tired and uninterested, and we had to ask a lot of questions to get what we needed eg wifi and a map of the area, both of which are fairly normal requests. We were pointed in the direction of a room that was n the ground floor between the toilets, the kitchen, the breakfast room and the little courtyard where staff put all the bins. Needless to say we asked for another room, but I was told by the receptionist that they were fully booked. Our sleep was interrupted by the air conditioning making a very loud buzzing noise (like an alarm) in the night - I sleep with ear plugs and don't normally have any problems with noises, but I had to get up, turn the air con off, then on again to get it to stop. Then the next morning, staff preparing the breakfast from about 6:30 again woke us. This was unavoidable, but the room should not really be used, it's the only one on the ground floor, and we could literally hear cutlery being laid on the table while showering! Breakfast was fine, checkout again fine, but I wouldn't really recommend the hotel. The staff's attitude could have made a big difference to this stay. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for an ok hotel. Funny smell on Level 4!”
Reviews.Author: lisa26186
Reviews.Content: My mum and i stayed at Hotel Carlton Capri for 2 nights in September 2011. We travelled to Venice from Florence via train. The hotel is just over the bridge from S.Lucia station. Tackling this bridge with a suitcase can be quite annoying but you get over it eventually. The hotel is in a very quiet street just off the Grand Canal. The hotel is not much to look at from the outside but is nice in the reception area. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and speak great english. Our room was on the 4th floor. The lift only goes to level 3 and then you have to take a flight of stairs to get to level 4. Lucky the porterage man took our suitcases to our room for us. The room and bathroom were clean but the rooms definitely need a make over asap. There was also this disgusting chemical like smell coming from the air conditioning. We told the staff and they said "yes we know i am terribly sorry we can move you if you like". Unfortunately for us though they were booked out so we had to stay in the room. The staff were very apologetic. Just do not stay on level 4. The hotel is quite some walking distance from the Rialto Bridge and San Marco square but it is a good way to see venice, on foot. If you are catching the coach to the airport, make sure you get the hotel to contact the porterage service to take your bags to the bus stop. The breakfast and breakfast room were good.This hotel was quite expensive compared to other hotels we stayed in throughout Europe. I would not stay at this hotel again but was ok for our 2 nights in venice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Eileenanddavid
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very clean and well located. They changed the towels daily and also made up the room. It was a 3 mins walk to the railway station and very easy for ferries etc. We would recommend the hotel and the staff were lovely. The room was large enough for three (couple with daughter) and three large suitcases on floor. Lift and ensuite made life more comfortable after all the walking through all the streets in Venice. The cooked breakfast wasn't much, but they tried, (Italians don't do breakfast well) but at least we didn't go hungry! I think it's a two star but felt like three or four.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Broadlp
Reviews.Content: It's a good location. Close to the train station. There are facilities close. The room was OK with a new bathroom and good air con.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JulieBN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton Capri for our honeymoon in Venice. Our room was very nice and clean and the staff extremely friendly and very helpful with restaurant tips etc. The hotel is in a great quiet location but still very central. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: mels25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beyond our expectation, the rooms very clean and the view from our room was awesome. We loved our entire stay at the hotel and needless to say our honeymoon was great!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss it, you'll enjoy staying in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramona1361
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel were very helpful especially in giving us very genuine instructions of how to get to the hotel from Marco Polo air port. It was exactly what I'd been instructed. The staff were very welcoming and polite. Breakfast was absolutely perfect with all you need for a complete breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: colin r
Reviews.Content: Very clean & tidy small hotel 100yards from Grande Canal, close to Plaza de Roma (airport bus drop off) and Railway station. Friendly staff and very helpful. Be prepared to get lost when you first try to find it as it is in one of the back streets, as most hotels are and the map provided is not detailed enough. If you like seeing more than just the main areas the small streets are a maze to be explored with restaurants on most corners.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DrJetsetter
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Clean with professional staff. Breakfast was good. Overall, I think it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Got Bumped to another Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyNz
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a policy of sending prebooked guests to other Hotels because they overbook. They have a sister Hotel called the Carlton Grand Canal which is a four star Hotel but we were sent to a different Hotel which did not have the same facilites as our booked Hotel. Shame on you Carlton Capri.

Reviews.Title: “More than just satisfied”
Reviews.Author: dougalHorsham
Reviews.Content: As per many reviews our friends and us stayed prior to a cruise. I had previously stayed in Venice at a much more expensive hotel on the Grand Canal which turned out to be a major rip off. This time after many hours of research decided upon booking 2 balcony rooms at the Carlton Capri. Directions as per website were accurate or should I say only involved one wrong turn and a request from the Sister Hotel Carlton for directions. We were only 3ft away from our intended alley and we were there. Reception greeted us warmly and we were directed to our balcony rooms via a lift and then stairs. No mean feat with large suitcases but very achievable. Rooms were lovely, Room 212 I think was ours, great size, large double bed, well equiped bathroom and the balcony overlooking other apartments but furnished with little table and 2 chairs and pretty flowers. The only night on our whole month long trip it rained it rained that night rendering my lovely little balcony unusable. Bed very comfortable and no complaints about noise issues at all. I must say, the only balcony rooms were on this upper floor and seeing as our friends were in the other had no problems at all. Breakfast room smallish but seemed to cope with the many guests and was attended by very friendly accommodating ladies who made sure coffee/tea was served to your table on entry and all food was replenished as per usage. Absolutely no complaints from us and this was the order of the day, no complaints at all. Directions were given to access the port, suitcases held while we further explored Venice and a lovely lobby to sit and collect our thoughts. Would not hesitate to stay here again as position is perfect for trains, buses, port access and just wandering around the beautiful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Finding it was half the fun.”
Reviews.Author: jakub
Reviews.Content: Venice, Italy is the most interesting city I've ever visited. We had the most fun trying to see the sights and getting lost in all of the alley/walkways over and around all of the canals. Finding the Carlton Capri after 12 hours of flight time was hysterical for the first of our party of 11 when they arrived in Venice. Fortunately, they met us at the bus stop:Piazzale Roma and showed us the way. You can also take a train from the airport. The train station in Venice (stazione ferroviaria) is just up the Grand Canal from the bus stop. As the crow flies...Hotel Carlton Capri is across the Grand Canal from the train station, but behind some buildings in the Santa Croce section of Venice. This is different from the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal which is right on the Grand Canal. You'd be best to ask directions once you get across the Grand Canal. However, if you can find the very small alleyway that starts on the other side of the Grand Canal: Calle del Bergamaschi..take it and then turn at the first right. Carlton Capri should be right there. Even the smallest of side alleys in Venice had a stenciled name up on the buildings. Once we were acclimated, we helped many lost looking people rolling their luggage behind them when we were near the hotel...it was too obvious. Speaking of luggage...make sure the wheels are in good shape because from the bus stop, you'll need to go over a minimum of 2 bridges with steps before getting to the hotel. The hotel itself was small and quaint. It was very clean and our desk clerk was very accommodating. The room keys were awesome. You leave them with the desk clerk when you go out. Our breakfast was above average. All in all, we had a wonderful stay and I strongly recommend staying here instead of in the crowded San Marco area.

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngeeMelb
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel and not that pricey by Venice standard. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We rang them to let them know our flight was delayed and asked directions to the hotel. When I told the receptionist webwere thinking of getting the water taxi, he told us how to get there by bus, thus saving us â‚¬100. This is what I call service. The rooms were comfortable and breakfast was also good. Very close to the railway station and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: 3xTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Carlton Capri for 2 nights before going on a cruise. The location was perfect for us, close to the train station, port and vaporettas. We did a lot of walking in Venice and found the hotel to be in a good location. Although the room was very small, it was clean and comfortable and suited our needs. The breakfast was good and the ladies in the dining room were very pleasant and cheerful. Overall, no complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toorex
Reviews.Content: First, I was assigned a room on the ground floor. This was despite an advanced booking of about 2 months. The room is very noisy, particularly in the morning when the guests upstairs are using shower/toilets. The reception can be extremely indifferent towards our enquiries. Overall, it was not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the city most serene”
Reviews.Author: chemist-cook
Reviews.Content: Close by (across the canal from) the train station, Santa-Lucia, the hotel offers nearly all the amenities one could ask for. Included is a fine and full breakfast. The front desk were very helpful in making a variety of recommendations. I'd gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Hestapea
Reviews.Content: Good service, great breakfast and friendly staff. The room was clean, comfortable and very quiet. We stayed for 4 nights on the fourth floor. The elevator only went to the third floor, but it was okay to walk up the flight of stairs...even with suitcases. To get there take the bus from Marco Polo for 6 Euros (very nice bus and not a hassle at all). When you get off the bus you will see a big yellow sign that says "S. ROCCO FRARI RIALTO". Go under that sign...keep on that path, you will cross a bridge. Once over the brigde, keep to the left and you will cross one more bridge. Then keep left along the canal. Take the second alley on the right hand side. The hotel is down the alley on the left hand side. The bridges have stairs that you have to carry your suitcases over. I would not recommend going to its sister hotel...much more expensive even with a 10% discount. We went for drinks. For two shirley temples it was 23 Euros and not worth it at all. We were bombarded with guys selling roses and guys playing acordians..they all wanted money. We also went for dinner and it wasn't great either. There is a great place if you go out the way you came, turn left along the canal...called Ribbot. Good restaurant. Also lots of little coffee shops all through Venice. Would only recommend a day or two in Venice...very confusing and touristy, but still worth a short visit. In Italy smoking is everywhere and smokers are not worried about blowing it in your face or throwing their butts on the ground or in the water. We also took the train to Florence from Venice for a day...beautiful and well worth the trip. The Eurostar is direct and about 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: extraordineri
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Carlton Capri is kind of an annex of the Hotel Carlton. It is set behind the hotel on the Grand Canal. It's nice and quiet and away from all the bustle of tourists and boats. You're literally in the midst of peoples homes so when you walk out you really get a feel of being part of that neighborhood. The one drawback is that you don't get a view of the canals or anything but the trade off is a nice quiet area and home feel. I didn't think I would like that before coming but once we were there and looking back it really was a great location. It was close to the train station, just a walk over the bridge and directly across. You can catch water taxis and ferries nearby. It's about a 30 minute ride by ferry to San Marco and maybe about that long if you walk (and don't get lost along the way). The hotel itself is nice and elegant. It's clean and the staff is wonderful and accommodating. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms full of marble and quite roomy. They have air conditioning so it was nice to have to escape the heat and humidity and especially to keep the windows closed from mosquitoes. They have a mosquito repellent plugged into the socket but it didn't seem to help as much as me going and buying a spray and taking care of it instantly. After that, the room was excellent. The halls are a little hollow and sound resonates. I could tell when our neighbors across the hall came back, but that was a minor thing. At least we didn't have traffic noise or anything. Breakfast is served in a nice breakfast room with the usual spread of fruits, bread, eggs, cereal, yogurt, juices, and coffee. There is plenty of shopping and dining nearby. Take a stroll in any direction and you're bound to run into a great place to eat or buy souvenirs. Walking around Venezia can be confusing but you'll find getting lost is a great way to find some nice, quiet nooks and crannies in the city. Looking back I'm glad we were at this location and not somewhere near the bustle of San Marco. After walking all over the city it was nice to come back to such a quiet place and walking down the alley to get to it really made it seem as if we were staying in that area and not just entering the front of another busy hotel. Some people might not like that and would want to be at the center of all the action and views, but if you're looking for a nice quiet place to stay with elegant accommodations the Hotel Carlton Capri might be the place.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED The Hotel Carlton Capri”
Reviews.Author: Krisy06
Reviews.Content: We stayed there after a 15 night cruise. Very clean. The rooms were a bit small. The staff was very helpful. One of the desk clerks looks like Steve Nash (Phoenix's Suns BBA) The breakfast was very nice. We would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Monchhichipk
Reviews.Content: I'd give a 5 if it was exceptional, but it was just okay. There was nothing to complain about, but nothing to be too excited over. Except the breakfast was surpringly more than I expected. Price is steap, but it's the same as all hotels in Venice not much of a view, since it's not on any canals, but it within a 5 minute walking distance of the train station.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Patzo
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Carlton Capri for a long weekend in May 2011. We booked a superior room with a third bed for our 3 year old daughter. the rooms were a little on the small side but cosy and manageable. Our friend, who had a single room, found his room to be a little too small, in particular the bathroom. The staff were always friendly and attentive. We were always greeted with a smile which is a nice touch. The location is great as it is in a quiet area but close enough to all the major sights. If you are arriving by train or bus, this is a great location as you don't have to travel too far with your luggage (one or two bridges). As a result of the good location, it is generally very quiet at night. All in all: more than a good place to rest your head at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amore Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: lovescruising62
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Carlton Capri prior to a cruise. What a delightful hotel. We had our own private veranda and a lovely room. Front desk service was always excellent and courteous. The breakfast was more than we expected, excellent and the lady who served breakfast was very efficient and extremely pleasant. The location near Piazza Roma was perfect. We ate dinners in the area just beyond the train station (Ferrovia) and found food quite good and reasonable. We used the vaporetti to get around and of course enjoyed just walking and exploring. i booked directly with the hotel on line and they were very helpful about how to get there. They gave great directions. We would definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and loved the balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Nursekittykat
Reviews.Content: Ideal location across from the station. Very peaceful spot in a crazy city with easy access to sights and lovely restaurants. Staff very attentive, knowledgeable and helpful, couldn't have asked for more. Rooms spotlessly clean with comfy beds and small but modern bathrooms. My room had a balcony with little table and chair which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but would not stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: mleppell
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd hotel me and my wife stayed at in Italy and this was our worst experience. We are definitely not picky people and don't often complain but had a few complaints about this hotel.. For starters, we did request a balcony room (which from what i can tell, there is only one), and they gave that to us which was very nice. The rooms were spacey but the bathroom was nothing special. Our main complaints come with the service of this hotel. To start, there was a hidden window in our bathroom that was open our first night, when we woke up in the morning the room was full of mosquitos and we had bug bites all over our bodies. After finding the window in the bathroom, which was behind the two curtains in the bathroom, we closed it. The maid, after cleaning our room, proceeded to open the window again, which was completely not necessary. Well needless to say, we did not realize the window was opened again and woke up again with a room full of mosquitos. To the staff, all 3 staff members we dealth with were extremely rude. Being an American that frequents Italy often enough to understand they appreciate attempts to speak the language, this hotel staff was not welcoming or helpful at all. We asked the hotel staff for directions and about the bus service they advertise on the front desk and the staff member gave a one word response while playing on his phone. These are mild complaints but we definitely would not stay at this hotel again and there are surely better hotels then this hotel which is hard to find although close to the train station, and beware, because the gate on the grand canal is locked at night and you need to walk around through some dark alleys. The breakfast wasn't anything to be desired either. BUT OVERALL WE LOVED VENICE!! Stay at their sister hotel the hotel carlton grand canal it looked nice, this hotel was its ugly stepsister.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: emzy_wemzy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Carlton Capri for a long weekend last month. The hotel is in a great location, just a few minutes walk from Piazzale Roma where the buses and trains come to. It is a little tricky to find and during our whole stay we relied on our guide maps to get around but the main tourist routes are signposted. Our room was a good size, with a good sized bathroom. It was always clean. The breakfast each morning was good but there was not a great deal of choice here. The hotel is close enough to walk to all of the main attractions but far enough away from the busy areas. The staff were very friendly and helpful. In particular, I'd like to thank Matteo on the reception desk for all of his help and suggestions during our stay. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I returned to Venice. Another tip - eat at Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo which is not far from the hotel. I'm sure if you ask at the hotel they will be able to give directions if you cannot find it. Its a fantastic restaurant which we ate in on our last night and we had the best meal during our stay there. It was very reasonably priced compared to the higher prices around the San Marco area, and a lot better quality too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: uvb25
Reviews.Content: Away from the tourist areas but close to the train station and bus stations. The hotel rooms were small but the rooms were clean and the staff was helpful. There was no internet in the hotel but there was an internet cafe close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: IAN_HUGHES
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel on location as it was away from the main tourist hotspots but close to the bus, boat & rail terminii. It was down a quiet side alley just off the Grande Canale so very peaceful at night, the best nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. If you need to find this on a map look for calle casa neuvo, behind Carlton Grande Canal, being Venice they miss this vital information from the address as the locals only give the house number and district and this hotel is quite difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, just across canal from train station”
Reviews.Author: aklaw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from grand European adventure and this hotel was one of the ones I booked us in so we could be near the train station. It was just a 5 minute walk over bridge to station so the location was perfect, but it did NOT feel like we were staying by a train station as this hotel is hidden down Venice's beautiful alleys and canals. We arrived early after traveling from Paris, via Cincinnati and the room was ready. We took the 3.00 euro bus from airport which dropped us off at bus station and it was a doable walk to hotel, maybe 10 minutes, but we didn't know where hotel was initially so we stopped every 3rd vendor and asked for assist and they were kindly showing us the way. We also lucked out and a young man bargained to carry our bags for us to hotel and this was a Godsend as sadly we packed heavy for 8 day cruise plus time in Paris and 4 extra days in Venice. So carrying bags for 10 minues would not have been great way to begin vacation. We found the hotel off hidden corridors of Venice and loved its out of the way location, but still mere minutes to trains, Frari ( a must see) and all the other wonderful San Croce sites. Hotel service was outstanding with directions, help with transfer to ship, where to eat, etc. We stayed in the triple room and it was very nice, also a great breakfast awaited us each morning. I am now hooked on Nutella and cherry jam with my croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Close to good restaurants, much cheaper than eating near to Piazza San Marco.”
Reviews.Author: Joshua85
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located very close to the bus terminal, train station and ferrovia. Close to good restaurants, much cheaper then eating next to Piazza San Marco. Good Quality/Price for Venice, especially at the Carnival time. Its a cosy Hotel, the breakfast is good, but basic. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with nice location”
Reviews.Author: AlexMykhaylyuk
Reviews.Content: Close to Piazzale Roma and railway station, out of tourist crowds, good starting point to discover Venice and surroundings. Pleasant staff, clean rooms, good service. Rich breakfasts and fantastic sicilian oranges. Ideal place for quiet romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Your stay :)”
Reviews.Author: BedzinRafal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2010 (Redentore). The room was very nice and clean (superior double) and had everything we needed including air conditioning. The bathroom was very nice too. This is really a lovely and quiet hotel with super location away from tourist areas with very friendly and helpful staff. Itâ€™s very good choice to stay in Venice for a very long timeâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Simply....sensational!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_boy1969
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in to be greeted by the warm and friendly staff to the moment I checked out and left, and absolutely everything in between, there is not one thing that I can criticise this very fine hotel. So much so I have already told my friends about it and I am planning to come again in 2011. Wow, if this hotel is not in the best location in Venice near the railway station then its second to none! The room was spotlessly clean and magnificently furnished. There was plenty of room for my luggage, and yes I was carrying a fair bit. The bed was so comfortable one couldn't but enjoy a great nights sleep. Breakfast was a delicious buffet of everything you ever wanted to eat in the morning and more. And as for the staff, well nothing was ever a problem and everything was greeted with a smile and a willingness to assist. Just like Venice is the gem in Italy in my opinion, Hotel Carlton Capri is the gem in Venice. I highly recommend and can't wait to go back. 6 stars out of 5 in my humble opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: broadcaster10
Reviews.Content: Very accessible to the train station. Good location, quiet area. Very helpful staff. Friendly and courteous. Good breakfast selection. Room was clean with a nice bathroom. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Texas057
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Carlton Capri was very pleasant. Room is clean and cozy. Breakfast is good, however coffee needs lot of improvement. Direction to the hotel is somewhat confusing since hotel is located in a secluded area of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler21
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel was convenient for the vaporetto and the train/bus station, if you could manage to find it. it's down an alley and the person at the front desk couldn't direct me to it. at one point, he asked me to look for store with wine bottles in the window for them to instruct me where to go. so, do yourself a favor a map your directions to the hotel BEFORE you start going up and down bridges and stairs with luggage. save yourself this aggravation and you should be alright. i had an early morning flight (635am) so i asked for help getting a bus to the airport and the front desk gentleman just pointed to a sign on the desk. i asked if they offered internet service and the response was "no." Nothing else; just no. They could have told me about Venice Connected which offers wireless on the whole island for 8 euros a day. Some assistance would have been nice but i found the front desk staff entirely unhelpful and more annoyed than anywhere else in Italy. the room was comfortable and clean. however, on night 1 my toilet backed up and i waited until morning to notify the front desk so as not to disturb. when i did, i was told how to fix the issue myself. (i didn't come to venice to become a plumber but i gave it a shot.) when i returned, i was told the technician had poured acid into the toilet and it was unusable but i could use the sink and shower. if i needed to use the restroom, i could use the one downstairs. i was upset they didn't move me to a good room with a working toilet but whatever. i went downstairs and that toilet was broken as well. i had to the use the men's restroom/water closet. the morning i went to check out, it was 4am and i had to wake up the attendant who was asleep on the couch and i needed to do this since the front door was locked in. other than the staff and the toilet issues, it was really reasonable. if they upgrade their service staff, it would be a fine place to stay. i can only recommend it because it's priced reasonably and close to the transportation centre.

Reviews.Title: “The helpful staff and the quiet location, close to the Grand Canal make this a great place to stay when visiting Venice.”
Reviews.Author: amrDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really helpful staff with excellent English. The room was nothing special, but I thought it was clean, and the in-room bath was nice and modern. My mother, sister and I shared a triple off the courtyard (a glorified alleyway, really), so we didn't have an issue with canal traffic noise, rather, I woke to pleasant birdsongs. The hotel is amazingly convenient to the Grand Canal (almost across from the Train Station and the Ferrovia water-bus stop). Be warned: getting from Piazalle Roma on foot, with heavy suitcases, is not as easy as the website leads one to believe. There are 2 bridges (staired) which one must cross to get to the hotel from Ple. Roma. I must say, the convenience to a waterbus was fantastic as my mother finds it difficult to walk far. If I have a negative comment, it is that the breakfast is a poor value. The coffee was delicious, but the eggs (the only hot option, I think) were an inedible soup. Would I stay again? If I were traveling with someone who had a low level of physical activity, absolutely. Otherwise, I would *consider* it again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinAdventurer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2010 and we loved this place. The room was nice and clean, and the staff super friendly. The room is quite small, but keep in mind that most Venice hotels are like that. They just don't have much room. You have enough room for your bags and to walk around a bit, but don't expect a large room, pretty much where ever you go in Venice. The bathroom was tiny, but sufficient. The breakfast in the morning was great. A warm breakfast! We also appreciated the location so we didn't have to schlep our bags across the island. We stayed right near the train station and then just walked everywhere. About 30 minute walk from the hotel to Saint Mark's Square. But it is such a lovely walk and part of what makes venice so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place, good price”
Reviews.Author: juicejuice
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton Capri is located very close to the bus terminal, train station and ferrovia. This makes it very convenient to get in/out of Venice and to get around the main waterways. The Co Op supermarket is also very close by. The locality of Santa Croce is also very nice, a little quieter than the heaving San Marco district but still full of lovely shops, cafes and has a major tourist drag: Lista de Spagna. It is also very pretty and I filled the memory card on my Digital SLR with all the amazing architecture and sights. The Hotel Carlton Capri is a smaller hotel, without facilities such as a pool/spa but of course you're in Venice so there is plenty to do around the place. I doubt many of the other hotels in Venice have "5 star" facilities, so in that respect Hotel Carlton Capri must rate very favourably against its peers. Overall we were very satisfied with this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: kenycw
Reviews.Content: quite easy to access this hotel from the train, bus water bus station...the room is clean and the whole hotel give u a warm feeling.....but there is no internet....

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Marleee
Reviews.Content: Very close to Termini, which is very good since you have to wheel your luggage up and down stairs thru the bridges of Venice (just have to cross one). Close to bus stop to go to the airport. You'll have to ask for directions to get there since is kind of hidden. Good location close to Gran Canal. Plenty of restaurants nearby for all budgets. The staff was OK, not rude but short in answers. Elevator is very small. Room was spacious and clean. Roomy bathroom with bathtub. AC temperature was set and weak (at least for August). Breakfast was decent. It's a basic hotel to go to sleep since it doesn't have any other amenities but it was quiet, clean and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivanov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite good; however, a bit expensive. But it is understandable as the hotel is located in Venice. Very clean. Our room was in a good condition, with a big double bed, balcony, nice bathroom. Breakfast was very good, for example, various fresh fruits were available (it is not usual for a 3-star hotel). The only disadvantage of the hotel is the absence of any Internet connection. The managers of the hotel could arrange at least one computer with Internet connection and printer somwhere near the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: awaywegowithkids
Reviews.Content: The staff are nice, the breakfast was not so great but included in the price. The lobby is nicer than the rooms, rooms are on par with a Motel 6

Reviews.Title: “Small and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Shue-me
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a double bed for 3 nights. The hotel has no frontage to the main sidewalk but was convenient enough through a side alley. The room we had (room 302) was very small - there was barely enough space to walk around the bed. But based on the floor plan displayed near the lift, our room was probably the average size for the hotel although there were 2 or 3 bigger ones, there were also 2 or 3 even smaller ones (which I can't imagine how). The TV was a 14 inch one and the airconditioning was fixed at 22 degrees Celsius. Both the window and shutters were sealed shut so there is no view to speak of and so the room was rather stuffy and could get warm. However, the breakfast was good and the staff in the breakfast room were helpful and friendly. Although I booked the room due to the closeness to the train station - I didn't know that the 150m walk entailed crossing the huge bridge (with some 20 steps up and down) across the Grand Canal which is no easy task with luggage. However, apart from taking the very expensive water taxis, I guess there were very few hotels in Venice that were on the right side of the water ferry stops and within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice time and a confortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JulioSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Venice. We were well impressed with the hotel. It was recomended by a friend. The location near the Ferrovia was very useful. The room service was very good and the breakfast well served,

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Quality for the Price - calm”
Reviews.Author: ã�Œã‚†ã�“
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good 3 star hotel for the price. Room is not very big but it is clearn with plenty of hot water, in a very calm area and is not far away from the railway station, which makes it easy for people travelling with the luggages. Hotel staff are all very nice and friendly, and the restaurant recommended by the hotel staff was very good as well. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff...”
Reviews.Author: BobmikeNYC
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is great! Expect a VERY small room (as is the usual with all hotel rooms in Venice). It's right across the canal from the water bus station (as well as the train station) so when you get lost in Venice (as everyone does!) you can just follow the signs (Ferranova) to the train station and you will find the hotel easily. Very friendly, english speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Palm_Canyon
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in what seems off the beaten path, but it is close enough to get where you need to go. The breakfasts were outstanding. It is a combination of American and European styles...and served up one of the best cups of coffee that I had while in Italy. The bathroom in the room will be interesting for those folks that don't do much traveling, but given the space restrictions it is an excellent use of space. The only problem that I had was that my credit card was charged twice for the stay...but the staff corrected the problem even before I saw it on my statement.

Reviews.Title: “value, location and helpfull staff all fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: mawCoLouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed in venice before on the mainland and found it a chore to travel in and out the old part of venice. Thought it would be to expensive to stay in the middle of one of the most popular tourist hunts in the world. But no. This hotel is in the middlle of it all in a quite back street a short walk to everything. Helpfull staff point you to where ever you want to go, book restaurants, and suggest options of how to get there. Rooms clean, comfartable, and traditionally decorated. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend to everybody”
Reviews.Author: vk_hu
Reviews.Content: a very good hotel to stay at when visiting Venice. location optimal, near to the bus station and vaporetto. staff friendly, room and bathroom clean and spacious (we stayed in a superior triple room). breakfast was OK, but the selection was the same every day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable , clean with excellent service and excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: hypercat
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night package at the Carlton on teletext at a very low price (well the flight was with Ryan Air). Given what we had paid and that Venice is very expensive, our expectations weren't high. We were pleasantly surprised. Arriving late at t the bus station the hotel was within a few minutes walk - if you know where to find it. It is down what looks to be a small alleyway and if you've not experienced the narrow streets of Venice, chances are you won't realise there's anything down there never mind a hotel. We had to ask at their sister hotel on the canal. However once you find it the hotel is clean, bright and cosy with a welcoming reception area. Our room was very good with a great, well appointed clean and spacious bathroom and highly efficient plumbing and shower. The bed was spacious and very comfortable. We were pleasantly surprised by size of the room and especially the bathroom. Furnishings and fittings were good quality and it was well decorated and appealing. Throughout our stay all the staff were super efficient and friendly. The lady managing the breakfast room in particular was a lesson in how to run a hotel , with super fast and friendly morning service. You have to be realistic - Venice is a cramped city where goods have to be hand barowed through the streets and the hotel soundproofing is not great so there is noise on a morning and you may hear other guests, tv etc. The breakfasts fall in to the slightly strange (to English tastebuds) continental category but offered plentiful food and good coffee in a very nice room. Take your own tea bags though - Italian tea bags generally aren't brilliant. The rather liquid scrambled egg bemused my partner but when in Italy..... The breakfast hours were very accommodating. The hotel is close to vaporetto stops, the bus station and given the size of venice, it is easy to walk or get the vaporetto to all the key sites. There are a lot of excellent trattoria's, small bars and shops nearby. The area is very quiet at night - don't be put off by the graffitti tags which are endemic to venice, its safe to wander the narrow streets. Arriving after 10pm we were directed to an excellent small restaurant round the corner that was open past midnight with great pizza and home made pasta. Given the astronomical cost of living and eating in venice it pays to eat local and away from St. Mark's square. We were not due to fly until the evening on our last day and the hotel couldn't have been more accommodating in looking after our luggage so we could collect it on the way to the bus station. All in all we were pleasantly surprised and very pleased we had stopped at the Carlton Capri. Although the location isn't flashy and it doesn't have the canalside view of its sister hotel, it punches well above its rating and price tag. Thanks to the staff for looking after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Service minded Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhaarler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel staff. The hotel was very cloth to the railway station and the Car park. It was easy to get around fromthis spot

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: MireilleM
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. The staff was trilingual (italian, french and english), helpful and even cheerful. My room (55) was extremely clean and the bathroom was prestine. Its location was strange (my door opened onto the breakfast area and my windows gave onto the staff entrance) but it was quiet and comfortable. The location of the hotel is wonderful - very close to the train station but away from the busy main streets. The breakfast was a little sparse but good. I would stay again in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DS221
Reviews.Content: This really is a lovely, small and quiet hotel. Its location is excellent - particularly if you are arriving in Venice by train - and it is well away from the noisy and busy tourist areas. Yet it is very convenient for transport and good restaurants. Our room was not huge, but had everything we needed including very efficient air conditioning. A joy! It was ready for us well before normal checking-in time and we were received very graciously by the helpful Reception staff. Breakfast was more than adequate and the staff, although busy, were friendly and courteous. We would certainly stay there again and strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but worth the search”
Reviews.Author: Waikatosflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: This is a smallish hotel. I wander down the wrong canal area and even had my back pocket liberated of its contence. Poor thief only got A very sketchy map downloaded from Expedia. Lucky I remembered the hotel name of a sort. At 7pm with all information outlets gone to sleep I am getting a little concerned . Dragging my case back to the bus drop off area, this I managed to find, just, I then approach parking warden who gave me directions to the Carton hotel. Well this is not the hotel. After enquiries there I was directed by one of their staff to the Carlton Capri down a few alleys from their hotel. (everything in Venice is just down a few alley's) Relieved to get to my base and key to my room on the forth or was it the firth floor. Room very tidy ideed, with secure roller blinds on the windows in the room and bathroom. Ceiling to floor. Keeps out the heat. View of rooftops. No fridge. Bathroom modern and all very clean. If you find this place then a stay is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable hotel in a quiet zone, but near the touristic center.”
Reviews.Author: NunoAdvisor
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel with a good price/quality ratio. The room was small but confortable and the bathroom was recently renovated. It only had a shower (no tub), wich was fine by us, as we don't take baths. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Good breakfast. Overall a nice hotel in a quiet area, but at the same time near all the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Close to bus and trains”
Reviews.Author: Boston080
Reviews.Content: Stay here as part of a Globus tour. The bathroom shower was hand held, not wall mounted. There is no internet service. Front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay near bus and train station”
Reviews.Author: smudge_mail
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and comfortable rather than spectacular. The reception staff were helpful Our flight to Rome was very early so it was imprtant to be close to Piazza roma to get the bus to the airport..... the capri was perfect in that respect. Getting through Venice with large suitcases can not be a pleasant expereince. The best way to get arund venice is by foot, but there is a river bus station within 3minute walk. Lots of local restuarnts to choose from and far enough away from the tourist traps

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sghisgrumpy
Reviews.Content: My two teenage sons and myself stayed here for one night in August and were very impressed with the friendliness of the staff and a lovely clean bedroom with super bathroom (with bath and shower!) It is in an excellent position for viewing Venice, very near the train station and Piazza Roma and walking distance to St Marks Square. Breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: iwishAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Carlton Capri is in the most convenient spot, a short walk to the main areas of Venice. The hotel was very comfortable and clean and I would recommend it to anyone. The only slight negative, the staff were not exactly helpful, the night guy in particular was totally incapable of smiling! Dont mind them, get a map and you will enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was swarming with bugs!!!! Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: europetraveler7
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. I travel to Europe every summer and stay at a lot of hotels. This was my worst experience yet. We had 2 rooms at the Carlton Capri. My daughters stayed in one. They had seen a bug or 2 during our stay but on our last night at 10pm, the room was swarming with hundreds if not thousands of bugs. They were on the walls, the windows, the bathroom, the floor and in our luggage. I was absolutely disgusted. I went to complain at the front desk. He came to our room with a can of bug spray. I explained that my daughters could not sleep in that room. He said he could not give me another because they were full. We checked out of that room then and there. All 4 of us slept in a queen size bed in one of their tiny rooms. We had a 6am flight the next morning. On top of all that, the Carlton Capri would not reimbursement us for the night that the room filled with bugs. They charged us for that room. Save yourself the heartache. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CitytripperFlanders
Reviews.Content: The location can't be better. Very close to Piazzale Roma (busstation) and railwaystation. Boatline to Rialto and Piazza San Marco at a few steps. Due to its location in a side street (just behind the Canal Grande) its a very quiet environment. Prices are average ( Venice is an expensive city !) but you get value for your money. Rooms are rather small but very clean and the personal is vey friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2310
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this as a birthday present for my 40th and paid a lot for it. But unfortunately and contrary to the pictures posted to their website, our room was ridiculously small and for some unknown reason unbelievable hot , during the day and unbearably so at night, Even though first day there was quite cold and the second average/pleasnt. We asked for another room but was told they were all the same. This is obivously not true as some of the reviews already posted show, many were large and very comfortable. The"bathroom" was no more than a cupboard with a shower in the middle that soaked everything when you tried to use it. It was stiffling with the door closed to use it as there was no window and towel rail was constanly on. We had to sleep with the window wide open to get some kind of air at night and this of course resulted in us being covered by mosquito bites. We were only there for 2 days and were very disapointed by the accommodation including the early morning workman from about 6.30am who were outside our window banging and drilling. The person on reception said they didn't start until 8.00am but again this was not true. Seems they pick and choose who to give good rooms to and therefore I would not recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a decent place to sleep or rest from a sightseeing in venice unless they are prepared to take pot luck with their accommodation. What was supposed to be a romantic and special birthday treat turned out to be a great disapointment and left us releived to be home again today..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sohrevardi
Reviews.Content: A belated review of the hotel from my visit to Venice last summer...Hotel Capri is situated right behind its larger sister hotel Carlton and Grand Canal Hotel. It is a 10 minute walk from the main train station in Venice (across the the bridge). One of the positive points about this hotel is that it is not hard to find. It is on a side street behind Carlton Grand Canal Hotel. Venice is a city that is hard to navigate around. Everything looks like everything else. Getting lost in Venice is the norm. The hotel is clean and the staff is extremely polite. Our room was huge by European standards, with a verly large bathroom. The elevator is very small. The breakfast was pretty good, although we found a worm in the fruits. I think this hotel is well worth the price you pay. Piazza San Marco is a long, long walk away from the hotel, however. Even with a map, we got lost trying to find the major attractions in Venice. The gandolo rides are a major attraction in Venice. However, you would have to pay about 100 EUROs for a 20 minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFriedmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in June, 20&21st. While our room was rather small, it was clean as was the tiny bathroom. The staff wqas very nice and friendly , easily helping us with transportation questions, how to get to the airport by 5AM. The breakfast was good. While this may be an older hotel, we were quite pleased with our stay and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “open sewer in front of hotel”
Reviews.Author: acynic
Reviews.Content: the sidewalk/road around the hotel was undergoing extensive work which entailed exposing the sewage lines. the smell was horrendous and the noise was unbearable; queen bed consisted of two rock-hard beds pushed together; television did turn on and the mini fridge was broken (one can only assume the juices in the mini bar were spoiled because of this). the breakfast was quite good and filling; security seems problematic as i witnessed the front desk clerk give the wrong key to the wrong guest on two occasions (and we were never asked by any of the rotating staff for identification when we requested our room keys each time we returned to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but....”
Reviews.Author: pak4u
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews we decided that the Capri sounded nice and was within our budget. We found it to be a nice clean friendly hotel. The rooms were a nice size and very clean. Breakfast was better than most places I've stayed in Europe. The problem was that they were repairing the street in front of the Hotel. The odor outside the hotel was nauseating and the lobby wasn't much better. The first room they put us in was in the front and we would never have been able to stay there. They moved us to a room in the back on a higher floor and it was much better ( though we dared not open the window). We asked how long they expected the construction to last and they did not know. Overall, it would have been a great place if not for that.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Carlton Capri
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 595, 30135 Venice, Italy
